ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: It made me engage with my work differently, the performance aspect in a studio practice is absent at this program. During my undergrad at UCLA we had a "newgeners" section to our education which informed out practice in the same way sculpture, painting, or photography would.
The list feels endless. This is the best course I've taken as a student at Yale.

This course was a highlight of my first semester at Yale. I learned so much that felt applicable to a multitude of art practices. This class would enthrall those seeking the interdisciplinary. I found the texts profoundly moving and even incorporated some of the texts on 'vulnerable collaboration' into a paper for my Anthropology seminar. I really enjoyed the classroom dynamic and culture that emerged as we continued to engage with each others' work as well as with the exciting theory. Not only was this class exhilarating in its rigor, it was also extremely FUN (heck, the final project was to host a party!); a learning environment in which the child-mind aided deep understanding of complicated material was fostered and inspiring.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: That class was great. The weakness is its not here next semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Specifically to other artists, not just in the MFA program. This school needs a stronger new genres program that could not only benefit MFA students but more importantly undergrads.

YES!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! As a young artist and aspiring art major this class made me feel empowered and invigorated to believe in myself and my voice as an artist. I would recommend this course to anyone thinking about pursuing the arts because I think conceptual dimensionality takes work to a new level that this class will challenge you and support you to reach.
